dlgLine.text: As you are all aware, a Sgt. Hartz visited us this morning, allegedly on behalf of a US Army scouting party.
He's asking us for 40 rations of food and twenty gallons of gas on his return. For this, he will convince his superiors to assist us with aid or possibly even evacuation when he makes his report.
This could be a way out for us. How should we proceed?
Finally... I've been saying it since I got here - we are not equipped to deal with this in the long run. We need to get these people evacuated and into a safe zone.
Those supplies are a small price to pay for our safety. And let's not forget the hope it's going to give everyone around here.
<To you> But I trust you to make the right call on this one, and I'll back you no matter your decision.
This a no-brainer - give them the supplies and let's hope they can move us out by the end of the month.
I was in the Army and it's not uncommon for soldiers to have to fend for themselves when supplies are tight. I can only imagine the state of the supply lines right now, especially here in Texas.

However, this 'scouting party' story doesn't mesh with standard protocol - it's too risky and too low budget. If there's really a safe zone, there's better ways to get intel - satellites, helicopters, caravans.
Something about their story... it's off. I don't have any proof - but that's what my instincts tell me.
<To you> If you think it's the right thing to do, I'll go against my better instincts and support you.
Like most of the people here, I want to believe the cavalry is coming... but in this case, I don't think we should do it.
It sounds so excellent, am I right? Everything back to normal and the US military taking charge and winning the war and all that?
<To you> I don't believe it, but I'll leave that decision up to you.
Yeah, I don't trust anyone. So... no.
So, here's what I think, okay? Try to keep up with me...
Fuck the military. If they had done their jobs, we wouldn't be in this mess.
<To you> Unless you really think this is the right call. Then okay, sure - I'll support it. But I better not regret it.
So, in summary... fuck 'em.
Of course we should support them and I think most people here would agree.
Isn't this what we've all been waiting for?
<To you> However, if you feel differently, I'll still back you. I haven't regretted it too often in the past.
This seems like the miracle we've been praying for. Perhaps God is watching out for us after all.
This shouldn't even be up for debate. These are soldiers - heroes risking their lives to restore law and order!
They ask so little for so much - of course we need to help them.
<To you> If you really can't - and I don't know a reason why you wouldn't - I'll support you on this...
My God, it's finally over. I can't wait to get out of here.
<To you> Looks like we've got a pretty clear cut decision to make - do we give them the supplies or not?

dlgAnsw.text: We can hold out a little longer. We're not giving them the supplies.
If it means getting out of here, we're going to give them the supplies.
I propose we give them half of what they're asking. I'll convince them we're doing our best to support them.
As leaders, we should all ration our food for a week as a display of our commitment to the people here to solve this.
We ate yesterday, so today we go without. We will resume normal rations tomorrow.
We have too many mouths to feed. Leave it to me... I'll take care of our problem the more direct way.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to not give Hartz and his men any of our resources. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give Hartz and his men 40 rations of food and 20 gallons of fuel. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to give them half of the requested supplies and convince them that we're complying as best as we can. Is that your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to immediately serve items that many here wouldn't normally eat to boost the immediate supply of food in the shelter. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The proposal is to cut food to the whole shelter for today in order to preserve more food for the future. It will be crucial that we find more food today. Is this your final decision?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: ...I'm not sure I agree with the implication of that decision. Are you sure that's how you want to proceed?

dlgAnsw.text: On second thought, I think we need to consider another approach.

dlgLine.text: The final decision is to not give our supplies to the military's scout forces.
If you really don't trust them to get us out of here, well then, I guess we'll have to find another way.
Why the hell not? How many more of us are going to die waiting around for another option?
A wise course of action. If the military is really coming through here, we'll find another way to make amends with them later.
A wise course of action. If the military is really coming through here, we'll find another way to make amends with them later.
Good. Until I see a plane overhead, I have little faith that anyone's coming to help us out.
Good. Until I see a plane overhead, I have little faith that anyone's coming to help us out.
Great. I like it when things go my way.
Great. I like it when things go my way.
It's not what I would do... but I can't fault you for being cautious.
The majority of the people here aren't going to want to hear this. I'm sorry, but I don't feel like your decision is respecting the wishes of the other survivors.
You're playing it safe, I understand... I'll do my best to try and handle the fallout from this decision...
I'm at a loss for words... If you're not going to try to find a way out of this place, then why are you in charge?
VOID.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I don't know if I would have thought of it, but it sets a good example and it should put a lot of people at ease about our intentions. I can get behind this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I think it's a difficult sacrifice that we can all make. Overall, it's a pretty shrewd move that should boost everyone's faith in our ability to get them through this.
I'm not really on board with this... but I'll cash in one of my favors to you and go along with it.
That couldn't be farther from what I want. You want me to give up food for these people? I don't even know half their names.
Eat less? You know, I'll do it because I guess sometimes you don't make me regret coming here, but don't make this a regular thing.
You want ME to eat less?! What the hell kind of logic is that? We're in charge - if anything, it should be the other way around.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
...I like it. I think it says a lot about all our character and I'm sure that the people here will appreciate it, and maybe even willingly cooperate with us through any further hardships.
I disagree, but... maybe you'll prove me wrong, I don't know.
It's a strong move... I like it. It sends the right message and buys good will in a way that nothing else will. Sure, we'll have to tighten our belts, but everyone will see us do it.
The decision is to give Hartz and his scouts with the supplies they requested.
Yes - finally. We can spend less time worrying and more time waiting for the Army to get its ass in gear and mount a proper evacuation of this place.
Yes - finally. We can spend less time worrying and more time waiting for the Army to get its ass in gear and mount a proper evacuation of this place.
If that's how we're going to do things, I'll back you. But only because I trust you.
I wish I had your optimism... but I think this is a bad call.
I can see where this might go over well around here... but I'm only backing it because I might need a favor in the future.
Oh, sure, great idea... Because the military handled the last evacuations so well, right?
...You know... Consider my support payback for the things you did that didn't piss me off.
I thought I made myself clear... I think it's a stupid fucking idea.
We're doing the right thing. Not only for those brave soldiers out there, but for the people here.
We're doing the right thing. Not only for those brave soldiers out there, but for the people here.
This was the only decision we should have made. You can bet I will make sure that the people here know what a solid job you're doing.
This was the only decision we should have made. You can bet I will make sure that the people here know what a solid job you're doing.
The decision is to offer Hartz and his scouts less and convince them we're giving them all we can. The hope is that he will still recommend us for evacuation.
Well, essentially it's still giving them what they want, so I'm okay with it. And you seem to be able to smooth talk people around here, so I'm sure they'll take it.
Well, essentially it's still giving them what they want, so I'm okay with it. And you seem to be able to smooth talk people around here, so I'm sure they'll take it.
If you really feel good about this, I'll support you on this.
Giving them less is still giving them something we earned the hard way. And I still don't feel good about this deal.
Hedging your bet... Sure, it's a gamble, but it's a calculated one. I like it.
Hedging your bet... Sure, it's a gamble, but it's a calculated one. I like it.
...I'm still not crazy about it, but you can make it up to me by not giving me any shit in the near future.
You know how many people I had to beat the shit out of for that stuff? Still a fucking waste...
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
I'd have given them what they asked for, but I do think our gesture will still be accepted.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
Well, we're still helping them... And to be fair, you can be convincing when you want to be.
The decision is to cut all food today, conserve resources for the future, and hopefully secure more food immediately.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
I can handle a lean day, sure, but we're really going to have to bust our asses and bring home full packs today.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
It's a compromise I'm willing to support.
I'm really not happy about this, but I'll back you up because I have confidence you won't make this a weekly event.
No food today? And what happens if we're attacked or driven out of here? We'll be dead on our feet. <Shakes his head> You people...
Do I look like I diet? Still, I guess you've stuck your neck out for me before, so I can deal with it.
So let me get this straight - I don't eat and you'll probably make me do the heavy lifting out there? Well, why didn't you say we were having shit sandwiches for dinner?
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
I don't think it's too much to ask. As long as we make progress on our food situation today.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
It makes sense, I suppose. As long as we come back with some food today, we shouldn't have to worry about any backlash.
The decision is to... find a way to reduce the population here at the shelter through whatever means necessary.
I... I really hope that you mean you're going to find a volunteer.
What the hell is this - the damn mafia? I swear on my goddamn life that if I hear you took someone behind a shed and put a bullet in them about this, I'm taking you down!
I have to believe you've got a better plan than just fragging the last person to piss you off. Right?
If you're going to turn this into a dictatorship, you better believe I will work with everyone else to depose you.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
Well, does anyone want to pick the last guy left for the dodgeball team, really? It's harsh but they're probably not going to last long anyhow.
If you're going to rule by fear, I say you have to draw a line somewhere, but on the other hand I'm fairly sure you won't pick me, so I'm willing to let it slide.
That sounds like something Marshall would do... And I'm sure as hell not going to stay if I have to live in fear of being on your shit list.
I hope this is just a misunderstanding... Based on our previous actions, I have to believe you're going to do the right thing.
I know that sometimes you have to kill because otherwise we all would be killed. But murder is a sin...
Well... I suppose you could always find someone who's unhappy and give them the option to leave...
No one is judge, jury, and executioner - this is madness! If this is how you intend to run the place, maybe it's time to elect a new leader!
That concludes our meeting... We'll wait for Hartz and his men to come back to inform them of our decision.
